intro: Draba turczaninowii, commonly known as the Turczaninow's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Draba turczaninowii is known for its resilience and is often found in high-altitude habitats where few plants can survive.
